articles.title: Lionel Messi Honoured as Argentine FA Names Training Complex After PSG Star
articles.description: Argentina's Football Association have honoured their captain Lionel Messi by renaming their training complex after Messi
articles.content:
Argentine football star Lionel Messi was honoured in the town of Ezeiza on the outskirts of Buenos Aires, where the Argentine Football Association (AFA) named its training complex after the national team captain.

articles.title: Argentina FA training facility renamed after Lionel Messi
articles.description: The Casa de Ezeiza in Buenos Aires, which houses the national team set-up, will now be known as Lionel Andres Messi "in tribute to the best player in the world", AFA president Claudio Tapia wrote on Twitter.
articles.content:
The Argentina national team’s training facility has been renamed after talismanic captain Lionel Messi in recognition of his World Cup heroics and star-studded career, the country’s football association (AFA) said on Saturday.
The Casa de Ezeiza in B... [1267 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-Argentina FA training facility renamed after Messi
articles.description: The Casa de Ezeiza in Buenos Aires, which houses the national team set-up, will now be known as Lionel Andres Messi "in tribute to the best player in the world", AFA president Claudio Tapia wrote on Twitter. "Welcome to the world champion's house," Tapia said at the unveiling ceremony attended by current and former Argentina players.

articles.title: 'I Imagined Returning to my Country as World Champion': Lionel Messi Pens Message of Gratitude After Hero's Homecoming Against Panama
articles.description: Following Argentina's friendly win over Panama in Buenos Aires, Messi took to the social media platform Instagram to express his gratitude to the fans who serenaded the team and their captain, who celebrated lifting the World Cup after a wait of 36 years at the Monumental
articles.content:
FIFA World Cup winner Lionel Messi received a warm reception from his adoring fans in Argentina as the Albiceleste played their first game on home soil following their Qatar heroics.

articles.title: Fired Marvel Exec Victoria Alonso Says Disney ‘Silenced’ Her
articles.description: An attorney for Victoria Alonso, who was fired as head of Marvel’s VFX and post-production, said the exec was “silenced” by Disney.” Disney called the claims “unfortunate.” Previous reports suggested ‘Argentina, 1985’ was a factor in her termination.
articles.content:
Photo: Jesse Grant/Getty Images for Disney

articles.title: Miami Open: Carlos Alcaraz, Taylor Fritz, Jannik Sinner All Breeze Into Third Round
articles.description: Defending champion Alcaraz defeated Argentina's Facundo Bagnis 6-0, 6-2 as the Spaniard got his title defence off to a smooth start. American Fritz saw off 21-year-old Californian Emilio Nava 6-4, 6-1, while Sinner registered a 6-4, 6-2 victory against Laslo Djere
articles.content:
World number one Carlos Alcaraz made an emphatic start to his Miami Open title defence, defeating Argentina’s Facundo Bagnis 6-0, 6-2 on Friday.
The 19-year-old Spaniard, the youngest ever player to top the rankings, is looking to complete the “Sunsh... [3442 chars]
